meanings.sent1: She drudged through her homework all night.
meanings.sent2: The workers drudged in the fields under the hot sun.
meanings.sent3: He drudged away at his chores, grumbling all the while.
meanings.sent4: The students drudged through the long exam, feeling exhausted.
meanings.sent5: The chef drudged over the stove, preparing a feast for the guests.

meanings.definition: To do hard, menial, or monotonous work.
meanings.sent1: Every day, she drudged at the factory to earn a living.
meanings.sent2: The janitor drudged through cleaning the entire building.
meanings.sent3: He drudged through the paperwork, dreaming of a vacation.
meanings.sent4: The artist drudged over each brushstroke, perfecting the painting.
meanings.sent5: The farmer drudged in the fields from dawn till dusk, planting crops.
